list.name: Default
list.comment:
A good evening/night here. Came back from the field quite late but have worked on a few classes - moving up the progress of the project. With a few challenges that we can work together on. Earlier I mentioned the issue with the mouse event/capture. it still doesn't work, I think if you fixed it didn't commit to the git. As soon as this mouse MouseListener issue is fixed our project is ready and all set. What I think however needs to be done to fix this which we can look at is:
a. the mouse events should trigger a repaint() library b. the combo box should be switched, if-elseï»¿
What do you think?
In summary, this is what I did tonight:
a. Mouse Events. I tried to deal with the design of mouse trigger events enabling the user trigger mouse events such as users to click images to draw elements on the screen when the users click on the panel the users simultaneously draw different shapes.
b. Graphical User Interface I have added a few functionalities to the project such as erase, redo and undo.
c. Polymorphism.
In order to keep up with the instructions for the assignment, i have created and implemented some implementation classes for My Line, My Rectangle & implementation for all the shape & filling respective colors.
Challenges:
a. Mouse Pointer Instances
As mentioned above, I am having issues with mouse clicks, tried to work on creating images with mouse on-click.
b. An implementation framework for the buttons and erase on-click events.
Once these are done, I think it will be fine - I have run similar in NetBeans and it seems much easier for the first challenge, for some reason with IntelliJ bit challenging.
Best,

task.summary:
Hi Jozef,
In line with the aim of the project which is to facilitate the modeling & concepts of object oriented programming through polymorphism approach. To explore the above part, Iâve so far developed classes that simulate & illustrate the objective of object oriented programming paradigm.
a. Main Class description & functionality
The main class is JavaPaintApp extending Panel GUI. This class models the Java Paint App Graphical user interface and allows users of Java Paint application to perform functionalities of choosing color, facilitate mouse events that allowing allows drawing of shapes, mouse dragging across coordinates through Java methods Paint Components. So far, I have created functionalities for undoing, clear, reset of colors, copy, and paste to be implemented via if-else clauses to evaluate userâs action based on the appropriate control structures.
Polymorphism
Various methods exhibit polymorphism implementation in the code. The classes shapes each Lines, Rectangle extends MyShape iteratively meaning that all the components of Myshape abstract class (super parent class that inherits all the base classes). All the functionality of Myshape can be extended to other classes. Lines, Rectangle & Oval abstract class directly inherit the getters & setters of the Myshape class implementation. Java Paint Main Class inherits the methods within each of the prescribed shape when the users choose the shape to draw. While I am still working and updating the project can you help me on the mouse click events, I have tried several times. I will make another commit tomorrow. Due to my less accessibility to internet.
Best,

A good evening/night here. Came back from the field quite late but have worked on a few classes - moving up the progress of the project. With a few challenges that we can work together on. Earlier I mentioned the issue with the mouse event/capture. it still doesn't work, I think if you fixed it didn't commit to the git. As soon as this mouse MouseListener issue is fixed our project is ready and all set. What I think however needs to be done to fix this which we can look at is:
a. the mouse events should trigger a repaint() library b. the combo box should be switched, if-elseï»¿
What do you think?
In summary, this is what I did tonight:
a. Mouse Events. I tried to deal with the design of mouse trigger events enabling the user trigger mouse events such as users to click images to draw elements on the screen when the users click on the panel the users simultaneously draw different shapes.
b. Graphical User Interface I have added a few functionalities to the project such as erase, redo and undo.
c. Polymorphism.
In order to keep up with the instructions for the assignment, i have created and implemented some implementation classes for My Line, My Rectangle & implementation for all the shape & filling respective colors.
Challenges:
a. Mouse Pointer Instances
As mentioned above, I am having issues with mouse clicks, tried to work on creating images with mouse on-click.
b. An implementation framework for the buttons and erase on-click events.
Once these are done, I think it will be fine - I have run similar in NetBeans and it seems much easier for the first challenge, for some reason with IntelliJ bit challenging.
Best,

Hi Jozef,
In line with the aim of the project which is to facilitate the modeling & concepts of object oriented programming through polymorphism approach. To explore the above part, Iâve so far developed classes that simulate & illustrate the objective of object oriented programming paradigm.
a. Main Class description & functionality
The main class is JavaPaintApp extending Panel GUI. This class models the Java Paint App Graphical user interface and allows users of Java Paint application to perform functionalities of choosing color, facilitate mouse events that allowing allows drawing of shapes, mouse dragging across coordinates through Java methods Paint Components. So far, I have created functionalities for undoing, clear, reset of colors, copy, and paste to be implemented via if-else clauses to evaluate userâs action based on the appropriate control structures.

Various methods exhibit polymorphism implementation in the code. The classes shapes each Lines, Rectangle extends MyShape iteratively meaning that all the components of Myshape abstract class (super parent class that inherits all the base classes). All the functionality of Myshape can be extended to other classes. Lines, Rectangle & Oval abstract class directly inherit the getters & setters of the Myshape class implementation. Best,

Best,
